constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 6 (Monday, January 11, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. BEATTY:
H.R. 236.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution
[Page H123]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committees on Education and Labor, and Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

title: To nullify the effect of Executive Order 13950 relating to combating race and sex stereotyping.
